title: FiveThirtyEight - Wikipedia
snippet: FiveThirtyEight, also rendered as 538, was an American website that focused on opinion poll analysis, politics, economics, and sports blogging in the United States. The website, which took its name from the number of electors in the United States electoral college, was founded on March 7, 2008, as ...

title: Nate Silver - Wikipedia
snippet: Nathaniel Read Silver (born January 13, 1978) is an American statistician, political analyst, author, sports gambler, and poker player who analyzes baseball, basketball, football, and elections. He is the founder of FiveThirtyEight and held the position of editor-in-chief there, along with ...

title: 50 Facts About FiveThirtyEight - Facts.net
snippet: FiveThirtyEight, founded by Nate Silver, revolutionized data-driven journalism and election forecasting. Its innovative polling methodologies and insights have reshaped public perception of polling accuracy.

title: Nate Silver of FiveThirtyEight’s advice to founders | Fortune
snippet: FiveThirtyEight.com, named after the number of votes in the Electoral College, was founded in 2008 by Silver as a data-driven news site that covered politics, economics, and sports—or, in other words, a blog.

title: FiveThirtyEight Media Bias | AllSides
snippet: Sometimes referred to as 538, the website takes its name from the number of electors in the United States electoral college.[1] Established on March 7, 2008, as FiveThirtyEight.com, in August 2010 the blog became a licensed feature of The New York Times online and was renamed FiveThirtyEight: ...
